epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Construction material for foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure, and other applications

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
product_classes.special_class: High-strength/high-performance concrete, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good or very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required

transport.average_transport_distance: 11.77 km from manufacturing gate to site

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from ready-mix truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

processing.recycled_material: Concrete recycled into aggregate replacing virgin coarse aggregate

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime
carbonation.note: Not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.secondary_data: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted

recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

other_life_cycle_stages_not_included.note: Practitioners should consider these for whole-of-life building studies
other_life_cycle_stages_not_included.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime not included in EPD results

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017
